title: 107_s2980
content: The Birth Defects and Developmental Disabilities Prevention Act of 2002 may be cited as the National Center on Birth Defects and Developmental Disabilities. Section 317C of the Public Health Service Act is amended to include conducting research on and promoting the prevention of birth defects, disabilities, and secondary health conditions. The Public Health Service Act is amended to include research on preventing birth defects, disabilities, and secondary health conditions. Subsection (d) is updated to include information on the incidence and prevalence of these conditions and their impact on infant mortality and quality of life. Subsection (b) is removed. The Public Health Service Act is amended to include research on preventing birth defects, disabilities, and secondary health conditions. Subsection (d) now includes information on the incidence and prevalence of these conditions, developmental disabilities, and secondary health conditions among individuals with disabilities. It also addresses any health disparities experienced by individuals with disabilities and provides recommendations for improving their health and quality of life. The Public Health Service Act is amended to include research on preventing birth defects, disabilities, and secondary health conditions. Subsection (d) now includes information on the incidence and prevalence of these conditions among individuals with disabilities. It also addresses health disparities and provides recommendations for improving their health and quality of life. Additionally, there are specific provisions related to privacy of information and access to data by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. The Public Health Service Act is amended to include research on preventing birth defects, disabilities, and secondary health conditions. Subsection (d) now includes information on the incidence and prevalence of these conditions among individuals with disabilities. Additionally, an Advisory Committee is established to advise the National Center on Birth Defects and Developmental Disabilities. Funding for fiscal years 2003 through 2007 is also addressed. Technical corrections are made for State Councils on Developmental Disabilities under the Developmental Disabilities Assistance and Bill of Rights Act of 2000. The amendments involve adjusting the amount received by the State based on previous years or Federal appropriations from fiscal years 2000, 2001, or 2002. The Senate passed these corrections on October 2, 2002. The document is attested by Jeri Thomson, Secretary.
